Posts.EditableText: It's happened all over the world, and now Australia has got it's share of extreme weather!  Not that anyone cares, but Melbourne got it's highest ever amount of rain in one 24-hour period yesterday (120mm), and the coldest february day ever.  I thought it was just California that was being crushed by bad weather, but now Australia is too!  Any comments on this would be greatly appreciated, as I wouldn't mind knowing if it's happening all over the world or just here and California.

Posts.EditableText:
In northern california today, it was a crushing 66 degrees, fair skies, and an ominous yellow sphere hovered in the atmosphere for about 12 hours. 

The end is near.

Posts.EditableText: Australians use the metric system, which means celcius, metres, centimeters, kilomitres, and so on.  So ITID, a metric conversion would be nice.
